.
FUNCIONES

```{r}
Pow_two <- function (x, print_info= TRUE){
  y <- x^2
  if(print_info){
    print(paste(x,"to the power of two equals ",y))
  }
  return (y)
}

result <- Pow_two(3)
result # las variables dentro de la funcion no son globales
  
```
R passes arguments by value
```{r}
triple <- function(x){
  x <- 3*x
  x
}
a <- 5
triple(a)
a
```
```{r}
linkedin <- c(16,9,13,5,2,17,14)
interpret <- function(num_views){
  if(num_views >15){
    print("Youre Popular")
    return(num_views)
  }
  else{
    print("Try to be more visible")
    return(0)
  }
}
interpret(linkedin[1])

interpret_all <- function(views, return_sum=TRUE){
  count <- 0
  for(v in views){
    count <- count + interpret(v)
  }
  if(return_sum){
    return(count)
    
  }else{
    return(NULL)
  }
}
interpret_all(linkedin)
```

LAPPLY()
posiciones con doble corchete, referencia para una lista

```{r}
temp <- list(c(3,7,9,6,1), c(6,9,12,13,5), c(4,8,3,-1,-3), c(1,4,7,2,-2), c(5,7,9,4,2), c(-3,5,8,9,4), c(3,6,9,4,1))
select <- function(x){
  print( mean(x))
}
lapply(temp,min)

list <- lapply(temp,select)
list
for(t in temp){
  print(min(t))
}

```
